General.Name: Media Prima Bhd
General.Description: Media Prima Berhad operates as a media company in Malaysia and internationally. It operates through Omnia, Broadcasting, Outdoor Media, Print Media, Digital Media, Content Creation, and Home Shopping segments. The company owns and operates four free-to-air television stations, which include TV3, TV9, ntv7, and 8TV; Wow Shop, a home shopping network; and tonton, a video streaming portal, as well as publishes, prints, sells, and distributes three newspapers comprising New Straits Times, Berita Harian (BH), and Harian Metro, as well as their weekend editions. It also operates five radio stations that include Hot FM, Buletin FM, Molek FM, Fly FM and 8FM; and provides out-of-home advertising services across various concessions in cities, expressways, transit network, and retail hubs. In addition, the company provides music production and studio recording, animation, talent management, licensing and merchandising solutions, and e-commerce services, as well as develops mobile applications. Further, it offers media content production, procurement, and distribution services; management services; digital publishing and social media content sharing platform services; and integrated advertising solutions, as well as outdoor advertising space and related production services; and other media industry related services. Additionally, the company is involved in commercial television and radio broadcasting, television programme, content production and distribution, video-on-demand services, provision of internet and digital-based media, production of outdoor advertising display, event management, and property investment and management activities, as well as advertising contracting and agency services. Media Prima Berhad was founded in 2003 and is headquartered in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia.
